intro: Psiadia arguta, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its leaves are hairy and lance-shaped, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head. Psiadia arguta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
